    \begin{verbatim}
function path_finder(waypoints, init_triplet, environment, max_dist)
    % List of triplets used to get from A to B, along the waypoints 
    % in the desired path
    final_path = []    
    % Go through each line segment that the waypoints constitute
    for i in range(1,len(waypoints)):
       % Find the triplets that give the shortest path
       final_path.extend(path_to_wp(waypoints[i-1], waypoints[i], init_triplet, env)
    end
    return final_path

function path_to_wp(previous_wp, wp, init_triplet, environment, max_dist)
    % Deque of triplets used to get the snake from the previous waypoint
    % to the next waypoint
    path = deque()   
    path.insert(init_triplet)
    current_triplet = init_triplet
    while(distance_to_wp(snake_head, wp) > max_dist)
        % Use A*-search to iteratively find the next obstacles used in 
        % the locomotion, and insert them into the next triplet. A*-search 
        % here returns the next triplet.
        current_triplet = A*-search(current_triplet, previous_wp, wp, environment)
        path.insert(current_triplet)
    return list(path)
\end{verbatim}

    


\end{document}
